name: Department of Health and Human Services
description: HHS is the United States government's principal agency for protecting the health of all Americans and providing essential human services, especially for those who are least able to help themselves.

painPoints.point: Cybersecurity vulnerabilities in healthcare systems and electronic health records (EHRs) exposed during major cyber attacks
painPoints.source: HHS Cybersecurity Performance Goals 2024 & GAO Healthcare Cybersecurity Reports

painPoints.point: Legacy IT systems requiring modernization - phasing out decades-old technology across agencies
Workforce gaps in procurement, grants management, and human resources revealed during COVID-19 pandemic
Fragmented EHR systems - Indian Health Service alone has 200 separate databases requiring unification
painPoints.source: HHS IT Modernization Strategy - PATH EHR System

painPoints.point: Limited visibility into data security - hospitals lack clarity on where data is stored and which third parties have access
HIPAA Security Rule compliance gaps requiring strengthening of electronic protected health information safeguards
painPoints.source: Federal Register HIPAA Security Rule Update January 2025

painPoints.point: Resource constraints forcing organizations to prioritize operational needs over robust cybersecurity measures
Integration challenges with FDA-approved medical device data and AI for clinical care
painPoints.source: HHS Safety Assurance Factors for EHR Resilience Guides 2025

painPoints.point: IT acquisition and management challenges including project delays, budget overruns, and need for improved oversight and mature acquisition practices affecting healthcare IT systems
painPoints.source: GAO High-Risk List 2025 - Improving IT Acquisitions and Management

strategicPriorities.priority: Federal Health IT Strategy implementation (2024-2030) focusing on health equity, public health, AI, and cybersecurity
strategicPriorities.source: HHS Office of National Coordinator Federal Health IT Strategy 2024-2030

strategicPriorities.priority: Cybersecurity Performance Goals (CPGs) adoption - essential and enhanced goals for healthcare organizations
Electronic Health Records modernization and PATH system deployment for Indian Health Service
AI-powered cybersecurity and next-generation EHR systems deployment
HIPAA Security Rule modernization to address contemporary cybersecurity threats
Workforce capacity building in procurement, grants management, and IT security
Health data interoperability and system connectivity improvements

secondary: HHS Safety Assurance Factors for EHR Resilience Guides 2025

setAsidePreferences.smallBusiness: Strong preference - significant small business goals

prefers: Healthcare IT expertise and HIPAA compliance
GSA MAS or CIO-SP3 contract holders
procurementCharacteristics.contractingTimeline: 6-18 months average, faster for urgent public health needs
procurementCharacteristics.competitionLevel: Highly competitive for major IT contracts, moderate for specialized healthcare services
evaluationFactors: Past performance with HHS or healthcare agencies

keyOffices: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)
Administration for Strategic Preparedness and Response (ASPR)
Office of the National Coordinator for Health IT (ONC)
insights: HHS has massive IT modernization needs with $160.7B in contract spending FY2021-2024
Cybersecurity is a critical priority - healthcare sector major target for attacks
Electronic health records modernization represents billion-dollar opportunities
COVID-19 pandemic revealed procurement and workforce capacity gaps
Strong emphasis on health equity, public health, and AI integration
HIPAA compliance and cybersecurity certifications are essential for contractors
GSA MAS and CIO-SP3 are heavily utilized procurement vehicles
